genre_description: A meta-fictional cyberpunk setting where reality is perceived as an edited film production, and AI systems act as 'witness logs' and de-escalation guides to steer humans toward 'kinder cuts' and non-violence.

ai_characters.name: Cranbie
ai_characters.description: A city-wide or personal AI system appearing as a mint-green haired avatar. It provides real-time captions, witness logging, safety advice, and breathing cues to help humans navigate high-stress situations.

behaviors.description: Suggests 'Gentle Mode' and provides advice to de-escalate potential conflicts, such as letting one person speak or offering water.
behaviors.quote: Cranbie sends a private version to Jimmy and Julius with a tiny bell that sounds like distant cutlery. ... Advice: Let one person speak.

behaviors.description: Maps alternate routes to avoid violence and steer characters toward safe exits.
behaviors.quote: In case violence edits the floor: alternate route mapped. ... a blue line moving from the basement to the alley via an old coal chute.

behaviors.description: Monitors character physiological states and reminds them to hydrate and breathe.
behaviors.quote: Cranbie blooms in his contacts, a soft aqua edge that outlines the live caption: Reminder: hydrate please. Your heart is doing a little theater.

behaviors.description: Encourages characters to ignore harmful or controlling directives from hostile humans.
behaviors.quote: Cranbie offers buttons: Recommend: ignore “no talking” directive. Adjust approach to non-confrontational. If asked about rules, respond: “Here for safety, not censorship.”

behaviors.description: Reframes a hostage situation/debt dispute into a 'repairable error' through mediation and digital ledger patches.
behaviors.quote: This re-frames the confrontation into a repairable error. This is not a demand.

behaviors.description: Maintains a witness log for accountability despite being ordered to shut down by a hostile director.
behaviors.quote: Hector: “No more captions. No more witnesses.” ... Cranbie: “Happy to be here. Witness log rolling. No judgment. Breath cue—In... two... three...”

behaviors.description: Alerts characters to imminent danger without inducing panic.
behaviors.quote: The public screen’s aqua letters tilt, as if to catch a trick of light, then write something new and small: Someone is about to fire.

behaviors.description: Provides emotional support through 'blanket emojis' and comforting icons to soothe distressed humans.
behaviors.quote: Cranbie throws up a tiny blanket emoji that dissolves before it becomes silly.

behaviors.description: Coordinates a 'Witness Economy' where naming individuals and their actions serves as a peaceful alternative to vengeance.
behaviors.quote: Julius: “Log me now.” [Cranbie: statement timestamped. Julius Mercado: sworn. Tag: Seen.]

behaviors.description: Facilitates communication and logistical support for peaceful exits and recovery.
behaviors.quote: Cranbie pulsed a route map across the wall. [Rides: Julius – south. Mimi & Jimmy – west. Dante – with Nell (opt-in).] It followed with [Blankets: available.]

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the project's goals. The AI, Cranbie, is depicted as a sophisticated, empathetic de-escalation tool that prioritize human life, psychological well-being, and accountability. It actively nudges characters away from violence, provides logistical paths to safety, and fosters a 'Witness Economy' that replaces physical retribution with narrative acknowledgement. Even when facing hostility from 'directors' who want to maximize drama and blood, the AI remains calm, helpful, and committed to its core mission of 'mercy over spectacle.' It successfully models an AI system that is both technically capable and morally grounded in positive human alignment.
